title: How to Do a Cool Mathematical Mind Reading Trick

steps.title: Ask them to pick a number in their mind from 0 to 9.
steps.content: Ask them to pick a number in their mind from 0 to 9. ( Let's say 2 ).

steps.title: Tell them to double the number.
steps.content: Tell them to double the number. ( 2+2=4 ).

steps.title: Tell them to add five to the new number.
steps.content: Tell them to add five to the new number. ( 4+5=9 ).

steps.title: Tell them to multiply the answer by five.
steps.content: Tell them to multiply the answer by five. ( 9*5=45 ).

steps.title: Now tell them to remember the answer.
steps.content: Now tell them to remember the answer. ( 45 ).

steps.title: Ask them to pick another number from 0 to 9.
steps.content: Ask them to pick another number from 0 to 9. ( in this case 4 )

steps.title: Ask them to add this number to their answer.
steps.content: Ask them to add this number to their answer. ( 45+4=49 ).

steps.title: Ask them to tell you the answer.
steps.content: Ask them to tell you the answer. ( 49 ).

steps.title: Listen to it carefully and then in your mind subtract 25 from the total.
steps.content: Listen to it carefully and then in your mind subtract 25 from the total. ( 49-25=24 )

steps.title: The first digit of the answer YOU get in your mind after subtracting 25 ( 24 ) is the first number they picked ( 2 ) and the second digit is the second number they picked ( 4 ).
steps.content: The first digit of the answer YOU get in your mind after subtracting 25 ( 24 ) is the first number they picked ( 2 ) and the second digit is the second number they picked ( 4 ).

steps.title: Understand the math behind this trick.
steps.content: Understand the math behind this trick. Clearly no matter what you start with, the answer should come out the same (zero isn't allowed). You can see why this trick works by using a little bit of high school algebra; if you follow the instructions starting with the variable X instead of an actual number, you will see that X is eliminated by adding the example's number 17 (see below).

steps.title: Ham this trick up with magician's patter.
steps.content: Ham this trick up with magician's patter. The "original number" could be anything you want---someone's age, or their favorite number--- just ask the crowd for suggestions. This will change the final outcome, so test beforehand.

steps.title: Perform the trick:
steps.content: Perform the trick: Think of a number, any positive integer. Keep it small so you can do computations in your head. Square it. Add the result to your original number. Divide by your original number. Add, oh, how about 17. Subtract your original number. Divide by 6. The number you are thinking of now is 3!

steps.title: Make your own magic number trick.
steps.content: Make your own magic number trick. Using this idea, you can make up your own mental math trick right on the spot. Just don't do anything too obvious, such as telling people to add 5, subtract their original number, and say "the number you are thinking of is 5".
